com.googlecode.whatswrong
Class CorpusLoader

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.googlecode.whatswrong.CorpusLoader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CorpusLoader
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A CorpusLoader is responsible for loading and managing corpora. A corpus is implemented as a list of NLPInstance objects. Each CorpusLoader maintains a list of such corpora, which can be extended by loading corpora from files. The loader displays the corpora and allows the user to select one such corpus. The selected corpus will then be used by other components (such as the CorpusNavigator to pick and render NLPInstance objects from.

A CorpusLoader sends out messages to CorpusLoader.Listener objects whenever a new corpus is added, removed or selected.

The CorpusLoader loads files using CorpusFormat objects. Each such object provides an swing panel that will be used in the file dialog to configure how the particular format needs to be loaded.

See Also:
Serialized Form
